reviews.review_msg: Apparently you can speak in every tutorial and lecture and still not get 15/15 for participation. I have no clue what John is thinking when he decided on how things are graded, but if the highest tutorial mark is 14.1/15 then I have no idea. Can't get above 90% cause that means you do work he can't do.
bad

1990 called, they want their statistics and articles back because even they know a hell of a lot can change in the environment in 30 years. Most recent article was maybe 2010? Still over 10 years old so the course almost a complete waste of time. Run, run as fast as you can.

I was genuinely excited about the content of this course, but there really could not be a worse man to teach it. Grading expectations are extremely unclear, even the ASSIGNMENT instructions are not clear. You have no idea how you're being graded. Though I will admit he was pretty lenient on deadlines, but that probably was because of covid

Assignment expectations are unclear and he wont clarify when asked. Wont provide rubrics. Doesnt keep his office hours. Doesnt answer emails. Doesnt understand basic science. Marks based on if you agree with his opinions. Clearly only cares about his work for the Parks Board not teaching. This course is frustrating and I learned nothing.

Save yourself and DO NOT TAKE A COURSE WITH HIM! Not everyone can teach nor should they! Spends more time with the park board than with his students and marking. Be prepared to feel confident about what you have handed in only to find out during the final exam that you have been doing poorly and it is now too late. HORRIBLE!!!!!!

If I could give a 0 I would. John is a nice guy I guess, but he gets a lot of science facts wrong and tried to argue that carbon capturing and advancing farming tech to be more sustainable where morally wrong and bad. Won't give you a grade above 90% because being above that means he could have wrote it himself. Don't take. Avoid at all costs. Run.

Nice guy but was disorganized and changed the final exam period on us 3 days before it was to begin. Never had a Canvas page and class never went the entire time. Everything always seemed rushed so he could end lecture to prep for his duties as a Parks Board Commissioner. We werent of most importance to him and it showed in his communication.

Very unorganized. Fell behind syllabus and went the WHOLE SEMESTER without creating a course canvas page despite promises that he would get it done by the second week. Instead, sent everything out by email. Frequently interrupts students and guest lecturers when they are speaking. Often gets side tracked with topics irrelevant to course material.

would not recommend this class with John. Lectures were not useful. The content in them provides you with minimal information. Read the textbook, do well on the assignment and hope you do ok on the final. Very unorganized. Got so behind on the syllabus. Studying for the final is very difficult b/c you have no idea what he talks about in class

Lectures were very dry. He was very very behind on his syllabus. We were 2 lectures behind at one point, and watched half a movie instead. He doesn't use Canvas or tell you anything about the TA. He marks pretty easy, minimal effort can be put into assignments to get a good grade. I would not take another class with him. It was too much for me.

John is a nice guy and is passionate and knlowedgable on the concepts, but hes teaching style wasnt my favourite. Lectures are tough to sit through but he sends slides before the midterm and final. 3 small written assignments(1000 words) that were decently easy and interesting

He liked to go off on tangents in every class. He is also very opinionated about social issues and goes off talking about stuff he doesn't actually know about (ended up talking about gun laws because of what happened in Vegas). Does not actually post slides, even tho he says he will. Dull lectures.

John has awful communication skills and will generally take a week to respond to e-mails, no matter how important. He goes off on tangents are does not give clear learning outcomes. Someone needs to have a serious talk with him about his teaching, because he inhibits the ability to learn and enjoy learning.
bet prof

John is a great prof for Geography. I believe that attending lecture is crucial to getting a great mark in his class. Every now and than, he makes hints on the topics that are going to be on the midterm. Map quiz is easy if you study. Essay should be started early. He tends to reply to emails late and send lecture slides at the last minute.

Easy class if you dont care about what is taught. Monotoned, reads off slides, lacks any passion to be in class and teach.  Doesn't divide course evenly- five things at best will be assigned for marks (mess one up, you're done.) Beats around the bush a lot (!) Also, beware of office hours! He has a tendency to have them an hour before class.
Best down to earth prof respect you Mr Irwin

lecture was boring, told class that he was gonna postpone midterm then emails 3 days before midterm saying jk im not gonna do it, read the textbook because all he does is talk about random things in class, map quiz was easy AF and  it's what brought up my mark, the essay was a mess didnt give us a proper criteria on what to write about

Satisfactory prof, although you can tell he is very knowledgeable. Made with laugh a few times with the odd Dad joke, which is nice. You will do well on your papers if you agree with him. Don't buy the textbook, I didn't open it once. Didn't give us the lecture slides until right before the final. You don't really know what to expect with assign.

I did not like his teaching style. Tries to teach too much in a short time. No feedback on the papers. He gets irritated easily. It feels like he comes to teach because he needs the money, not because he really wants too.

Learned a lot from this course! 2 assignment papers, 1 term paper, and a final exam (short answer and essay question). Not bad if you're interested in the subject and are a good/okay writer. Lots of article readings, didn't really read the textbook though. (Textbook was available online + free)

Okay, it's not a good elective unless you are super interested in environment or you love to write. I found the syllabus pretty confusing too. Lecture slides can be a bit too broad/vague/irrelevant. He is an inspirational prof for sure, but it seems like he's more interested in his research areas than teaching. Not recommended as a GPA booster

Pros: Notes are reasonably clear. Exam was 100% related to class content. Passionate about what he teaches, and you can tell. Cons: Assignments/exam were marked with heavy criteria and exact essay conventions in mind (was not a writing course). Extremely boring lecturer; difficult to stay awake.

John is a great prof. I have four of his geography class now, and I am about to take more his class. He is now BORING anymore. if u like geography especially about transportation, u will find he is actually very interesting. Even if u are not that into geography, he still fun sometimes. he like play rap and funny videos during the break
John is a great guy, and a great professor. He is really fair, and he gives detailed expectations for his projects and assignments. I have two other classes with him. I would recommend his classes!

John is very nice, he has a monotone voice but still is good at lecturing. Provides good info & examples. Not a hard class & the papers were not hard to write. I didn't really find reading the online book to be important just pay attention in lecture. The final was pretty easy as long as you know what was said in lecture. Its a good 1st year class

Pretty cool class. John discusses relevant topics to resource management. He is really into this subject, has great everyday examples to help you understand the material better. He always encourages questions and always gives thoughtful responses. 2 smaller papers and 1 longer paper marked fair. Ppt handed out end the end of semester to help study

I hope to have John as a prof again in the future. Everything brought up in class was really relevant, and you can tell his knowledge goes far beyond resource management and geography. He's actually a really inspirational guy; he often rides his bike to school and sometimes brings up the ways he tries to live more sustainably. It was a great class!

John is a knowledgeable, kind of passionate professor. he shared experiences to us which is very relevant to the topic. insightful, helpful and give you a fair to good marks as a whole. recomment this prof if you want to learn something. don't treat this course as gpa booter though, but it will definitely not dropping your gpa

Despite his monotone way of talking, he's very interesting, insightful and passionate, and cares a lot about students. His stories are usually examples related to the slides, so if you can type fast enough they provide a useful tool for understanding the material. I've had him twice and he's sent out lecture slides very close to the exam date

Really nice prof. Very fair marker. Assignment scheme is the same for most of his classes. 1 short presentation, 1 short paper and 1 term paper. Finals are tougher but not unreasonable. Do all the readings (very important for the final) and pay attention to whats on the slides.

John's passion for his field is evident. If you ask, on a sunny day he'll take you on a field trip to show you some work he's done around the city. He sends out lecture slides at the end to study for the final. Assignments are easy, you can all-nighter most of them and get a decent grade, so I expect if you try you'll do really well.

If you want a bubbly,cheery prof, John is not it.If you want a prof who is involved in his community,has lots of interesting and rad ideas abt how to change the world,then you will love him.Fair marker, extremely student friendly,passionate abt his material.Be prepared to type fast,pay attention to readings,you will do just fine!

I can tell that he tried to be interesting, but he is just boring. He is a nice guy overall. You will have to rush during taking notes from his huge wordy slides. He DOES NOT provide any ppt from his lecture, so you better attend his lecture every time. Marking was fair, but you will need to put a lot of effort  for your assignment.
Expects you to take notes but doesn't leave the slides up long enough to copy. Says he will send out slides but doesn't. Talks way too much about himself. Monotone and boring.

Hard to pay attention to as he is monotone and rambles, but he does have interesting views that are worthwhile. Attendance is recommended to be mandatory as he does not send out slides. Final was easy, as long as you put some effort into studying

Lectures are a bit boring. However, he has an interesting personality, with lots of personal stories. You must write down the slides as he does not send them. The final was slightly tricky. Overall I recommend him

John's an awesome instructor and injects some punishingly funny humour into his lectures that morons and air headed university girls cant quite grasp. *Very* funny prof with a ton of life experience outside the academy. Easily one of the better profs I've ever had at SFU. If you can't connect with what John's teaching, *you're* the problem.

I had John for 2 courses last semester(GEOG 100 and GEOG 389. Lectures are  dull but he's a  nice guy. Once you get used to his teaching style you'll notice he tries to be funny at times, and he actually knows a lot about what is going on in the world. Lectures are recorded, but slides are not available. Oh and the finals were fair/easy.

Good professor and helpful. Passionate about the environment, so much so that his Human Geo course has heavy environmental bend. He records lectures, but doesn't provide slides. Bring something to type with because he covers a lot of material. Slides are extremely helpful study notes. Midterm and exam were easy, but a lot of material to memorize.

I kinda agree with what people say about his monotone voice. But if you listen to what he says he actually has a lot of interesting things to say, though it is hard to listen when your frantically writing down what's on the slides. Most down to earth prof I have ever had, by far.

John really knows his stuff. I would use the word "passionate" to describe his views on the environment. It's easy to see his bias, but unless you disagree with it, a lot of what he says makes sense. He's a bit geeky but it's endearing to his character. Make sure you keep up with the text and especially tutorials. The final was the hardest part.

He is a bit boring and monotone but he defiantly knows his material and is a smart guy. The papers in this course were marked so easy (3 small papers overall) but the exams were difficult.Try to stay on top of the textbook chapters & study really hard. You can get by with getting good grads on papers, a good grade on tutorial and a OK grade on exam

To those who complain about him not giving out ppt for notes, learn to take notes scrubs. Do your readings and pay attention to the concepts not all the finest details. Don't complain, he's a fair marker and is informative. Follow his guidelines and put effort into the materials. We're not in highschool anymore Toto!

John is awesome, he is a great guy. I love all of his classes. He may seem boring- but if you listen closely he actually says some very interesting comments/ stories.    It isn't hard to get a good mark in his class if you go to lecture.
Monotone lectures and the powerpoints are incredibly wordy. Nice guy just boring..
Classes are super boring and he is very monotone and hard to understand

Great prof, very passionate about what he does - bit monotone but funny, goes through slides FAST so bring a laptop, however lectures are recorded - but it takes longer to type up notes from recordings so just attend the lectures. Fair marking, fair assignments and encourages discussion - took REM 100 with him as well.

I really like. He's really nice, makes subtle jokes, is passionate about the lectures and assignments. He can be too quick, monotone, unclear but he'd be glad to meet with you and explain. I took a second class with him bcz he's so great :)

John's an incredibly smart guy. I was blown away at the beginning of the semester. He has a monotone voice which makes him hard to follow sometimes. Also, he doesn't provide lecture notes so I was always scrambling to get down what he was saying and usually ended up missing a lot of it. No midterm, and final was a little hard, but he's a good guy.

Good guy, genuine passion for what he teaches, but he's way too biased. He says he tries to present both sides, but he doesn't. When he does his portrayal of the other side is biased. He is a bit naive, doesn't understand a lot of technology, and is a bit boring to listen to. Although all things said and done, he's a decent prof. Just a bit naive.

This prof is really passionate about what he is teaching. He really believes that education in Geography can change the way we think about the world. Uses personal stories and examples to reinforce the course material. Such a great class!

A really nice guy. Not too hard of a marker. Really believes in the stuff he teaches and tells funny life stories from time to time. His powerpoints are a bit wordy, but nothing to be frightened about. As long as you attend class, you should get a decent mark.

If you can write a decent essay and pay attention, you should be fine in the class. Use your laptop to take notes, only way I could keep up.  Seems like a good guy, but is very left-wing/liberal and doesn't try to hide it.  He focuses more on social geog than physical, which is great for tests.  Overall, a decent class to get a good mark.

Did no provide lecture slides, every class you had to race your typing against his speaking. Although the final was very clearly outlined, the other parts of the course was not. I do not see this course as a GPA booster.

One word: Boring! But you need to attend class to write his notes. First assignment: 4-page analysis, term paper: 8-10-page essay, last assignment (which he assigns the last week before finals): 4-page media analysis. This is a first-year course. Hello? Attend tutorial b/c that gives you a free 10%. Concepts are easy to grasp, though.
Very boring prof. Lectures were terrible and hard to follow. No real structure to the class and marked much harder than it should have been.

John is a great prof. He is genuine and really wants you to do well. He does not provide lecture notes to encourage note taking and attendance. His exams and assignments are very fair. His voice is monotone so if you can't handle it don't take his class.

Very Good Prof. Make sure to have a laptop handy and ask lots of questions. He is very willing to explain in detail what he expects, and as long as you follow his guidelines you cant fail.The Tutorial was kinda dry with lots of presentation, which is better than group discussions since the class size was about 45 in only one tutorial at SFU HC
Your new best friend will be your laptop. Reads off slides, but doesn't post them. Nice guy though.

This dude is boring.  His lectures are recorded only.  He doesn't provide you with the ppts.  You better come to class with a laptop because if you're gonna write notes on hand, you'd better write at the speed of light.

Boring class. Fair marker, slightly on the harder side though I must say. Content is not difficult to grasp but lots of reading and his monotone lectures dont help. Lectures are taped. Nice prof that does care about you though.

Okay prof. You can tell he loves the stuff he is talking about and believes it. Looooots of notes to take, mostly he reads off the slides. Hard to tell if he adds things in because you have to type at the speed of light to get everything down. Only recommend if you are interested in the subject.

Pretty brutal.  Guy can't lecture worth sh*t (but you have to go and listen to him read off his slides and frantically write/type it because he doesn't post them) and expects you to write fully formatted and cited research papers without actually teaching you how, despite being a 1st year class.  Passionate and knowledgeable about the field though.

A fair marker on all assignments and papers. Boring lectures with his monotone voice. The prof is very knowledgeable and knows his field very well. You should have a good environmental knowledge background if you want to take this class.

I took human geography with him. the only reason was because it was the only open class, he is okay, really tries hard to get everyone involved but that's not what always happens! doesn't like it when you don't agree with him. didnt help much with the paper, could not even clarify to me what he wanted, but the final was quite easy but go to lecture
He's okay. Mediocre prof. But if you're smart and knowledgeable you should do fine in his classes.

John's a funny, laid back guy. He wears his politics on his sleeve, but backs it up with evidence and experience. Yeah, his voice is somewhat monotonous--but why should a prof have to act like Andy **** just to get your attention? The tutorial involved multiple presentations on the same article, which wasn't great, but the class was good overall.
He is a really nice guy and he loves the environment. He does speak in monotone but his lectures are really interesting.  Readings were relevant but a bit much.
Very nice professor, gives great examples when explaining something, tries very hard to keep class active and involved and does a good job at it.
A very nice and approachable professor, attributes which professors at SFU lack. He was extremely fair on tests and assignment.

John was incredibly helpful and often available outside of class for extra support. His readings, lectures and tutorials were super interesting. Yes, he's a chill guy but he knows his stuff and has lots of interesting things to contribute to the class. Definitely a keystone course in my undergrad.
He could be a good teacher.... if he put more life into his lecture. its to hard to focus on a quiet monotone lecture at 7 at night

he is the worst prof ever. always goes on tangents and refers to philosophers I've never even heard of. reading requirements were way too much.  he throws a lot of notes at you and you never have time to write them all down. he needs to slow down a little.  i would not recommend this guy at all.
Great class. Professor loves getting students involved. Would highly recommend.
3 hour lecture.... killer. he just throws a lot of info at you and its really hard to follow all of it. and his midterms and finals are rather tough. but he's a funny guy
OMG he had no idea how to teach and the TA was not any better!  Avoid at all cost!!!

This course is ridiculous. The reading requirement is MASSIVE (more like an english course). The tutorials did not provide help. The prof reads directly from Powerpoint and books. Not recommended for those who are unsure about taking this course. GOOD LUCK if you do!!
